name: Banking Fort Knox
title: Highest Bank Liquid Reserves
description: In 2024, Libya's bank liquid reserves to bank assets ratio reached an impressive 214.12%, showcasing the country's robust financial stability.

name: Oil-Powered Economy
title: Oil Dominates GDP
description: In 2021, oil rents constituted 56.38% of Libya's GDP, highlighting the nation's heavy reliance on its oil sector.

name: Resource Rich
title: High Natural Resource Rents
description: Libya's total natural resources rents accounted for 61.03% of GDP in 2021, indicating the country's wealth in natural resources.

name: Industrial Backbone
title: Industry Leads GDP Contribution
description: In 2023, the industry sector, including construction, contributed 77.34% to Libya's GDP, underscoring its pivotal role in the economy.

name: Insurance Export Giants
title: Leading in Insurance and Financial Services Exports
description: In 2021, insurance and financial services made up 67.03% of Libya's service exports, marking the country as a key player in this sector.

name: Reserves Galore
title: Ample Total Reserves
description: Libya had total reserves equivalent to 36.81 months of imports in 2021, reflecting a strong buffer against economic shocks.

name: Energy Minimalist
title: Lowest Alternative and Nuclear Energy Usage
description: In 2020, Libya's alternative and nuclear energy usage was just 0.01% of its total energy consumption, marking it as one of the lowest globally.

name: Government Debt Decline
title: Significant Reduction in Government Claims
description: In 2022, Libya experienced a -23.65% annual growth in claims on the central government as a percentage of broad money, indicating a significant reduction in government debt.

name: Money Matters
title: Low Broad Money Growth
description: Libya's broad money growth was -20.26% in 2021, reflecting a significant contraction in the money supply.

name: Infrastructure Challenges
title: Poor Trade and Transport Infrastructure
description: With a score of 1.7 in 2022, Libya's trade and transport infrastructure quality is among the lowest, impacting logistics performance.

name: Savings Shortfall
title: Negative Gross Savings
description: In 2020, Libya's gross savings were -14.16% of its GNI, indicating a significant shortfall in national savings.

name: Tax Troubles
title: Negative Taxes Less Subsidies
description: In 2023, Libya's taxes less subsidies on products were -9,845,000,000 LCU, highlighting fiscal challenges.

name: Law and Order
title: Low Rule of Law Confidence
description: In 2023, Libya's rule of law percentile rank lower bound was 0.94, indicating challenges in governance and legal frameworks.

name: Sober Society
title: Minimal Alcohol Consumption Among Women
description: In 2020, Libyan women aged 15+ consumed just 0.002 liters of pure alcohol per capita, one of the lowest globally.
